nodes.bodyText:
I'm all for adopting grid 👍
Does this mean IE is not considered part of the browser support matrix? https://caniuse.com/#feat=css-grid
Correct, yeah. In the new UI we are no longer supporting IE11.

is the div prefix on each part of the section needed for specificity?
Could it be dropped?
Fixed. It did need the full path to ensure it only affects the selection session, but the div parts weren't necessary.

are the divs needed here? could they be omitted?

            div#selection-content-inner.search-layout
          
          
            
              div.mainCols
          
          
            
              div#col2

            #selection-content-inner.search-layout
          
          
            
              .mainCols
          
          
            
              #col2
          
          
            
              #selection-summary {

else where @include is done as the first part of a block.
Is the order sensitive here? could this be moved to the top of the block?

Not all of them were, quite a few were in other locations.
In any case, order doesn't matter. Mixins just get added in-place.
I've gone through and move all @include buttonShadowBorder; to the top of their blocks.

If display: none, then wouldn't the background-image be redundant?
Also, maybe a comment explaining why this is 'none' could be handy. 🤔

This is for a small down arrow that appears on an attachment row in a selection session - but there's nowhere to put it because of the icon button. It was actually sitting directly under the button before so it went unnoticed, but now they have changed shape it looks wrong.

The formatter is actually doing that. If I fix it, format:scss breaks it again.
I think it's because the first part of the selector isn't indented, that's what it seems to be going off of.
